medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant abdominal pain and malaise.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began yesterday without clear precipitant. The pain is somewhat diffuse but locally worse in the right lower quadrant. The patient reports breaking out in sweats and experiencing chills since the onset of pain. Anorexia and nausea are present but no vomiting. Dietary intake has been limited to a few strands of spaghetti. Denies constipation, diarrhea, bloody or tarry stools, hematuria, and radiation of pain to shoulder/neck/back.
medical_history.past_medical_history: GERD, hemorrhoids, depression, hypertension, hypertriglyceridemia, glaucoma, sciatica, colon polyps, vertigo.
medical_history.family_history: Positive for colon cancer in her father; family history of diabetes, hypercholesterolemia, and heart disease. One brother died of metastatic cancer (origin unknown).
